block.p: Dr. Caroline Margaret Webber, a daughter of the Rev. Christopher L. Webber and Margaret Webber of Sharon, Conn., was married yesterday to Anthony Leigh Grant, a son of Nancy Parkford Grant of Mill Valley, Calif., and the late James E. Grant. The bride's father, the vicar of Christ Episcopal Church in Canaan, Conn., performed the ceremony at St. John's Church in Ross, Calif.

Dr. Grant, 33, is to become an instructor in expository writing at the San Francisco Art Institute next month. She graduated magna cum laude from William Smith College and in May received a Ph.D. in comparative literature from the University of California at Berkeley. Her mother is a travel agent in Sharon. The bride's maternal grandfather, the late Rev. Lawrence Rose, was a dean of the General Theological Seminary in New York.

Dr. Caroline Margaret Webber, a daughter of the Rev. Christopher L. Webber and Margaret Webber of Sharon, Conn., was married yesterday to Anthony Leigh Grant, a son of Nancy Parkford Grant of Mill Valley, Calif., and the late James E. Grant. The bride's father, the vicar of Christ Episcopal Church in Canaan, Conn., performed the ceremony at St. John's Church in Ross, Calif.

Dr. Grant, 33, is to become an instructor in expository writing at the San Francisco Art Institute next month. She graduated magna cum laude from William Smith College and in May received a Ph.D. in comparative literature from the University of California at Berkeley. Her mother is a travel agent in Sharon. The bride's maternal grandfather, the late Rev. Lawrence Rose, was a dean of the General Theological Seminary in New York.

Mr. Grant, 31, is a software engineer in Redwood City, Calif., for Excite@Home, the Internet company. He graduated from Tufts University. His father was a painter and sculptor in Stinson Beach, Calif.
